Author: kolo#1111
Content: I apologize to everyone who felt hurt by my decision to allow @SHossain and @Decker to work in their own regions unlike voters decided (who were far away from our internal kitchen and voted in random directions). I insist this decision gave network a lot of benefits and made 0 hurt. But that should not happen.

Author: Decker#3767
Content: @Alright probably you just forget one thing ... one year seems a long time ... @SHossain won 2 spots last year - AR and EU, and i won a EU spot. We just exchanged spots AR <-> EU, bcz it was comfortable for me to place hardware in AR, and for SHossain in EU. But you can count that decker_EU is equal to alien_AR and alien_AR is equal to decker_EU . Just @SHossain controls my decker_EU node which is named alien_AR and me controls alien_AR node which is called decker_EU. Now ... let's see the stats ... both nodes is in TOP of their regions. Mean, decker_EU win the spot and alien_AR win the spot ... doesn't matter who actually control each of them, me or @SHossain ... and `0dev4_decker` is just an `dev` node for 2019 ... So, AR region **owe** us a spot ) But i'm just agree with Kolo's decisions ... and i wish to see a "new blood" in a NN rows. That's why i didn't want to say anywhere that my node is auto re-elected, but it's true, and according to rules i have all rights on the spot in AR. Think about it )

Author: Decker#3767
Content: **p.s.** Also, i don't want to continue threads like this here ... simple bcz **we are community** and doing a common thing. Mean, we all trying to do our best for community, and in my opinion - threads like this with blaming somebody is unacceptable here. We should focus on other things ...

Author: Decker#3767
Content: *p.p.s.* Sadly to read things like this at my birthday ... ( I was absent here today, bcz celebrating with my family ...

Author: Strob#3417
Content: But it seems running the wallet reset helped a bit I did 7 nots in the last 2 hours which is already a lot better than 6 not in 6 hours!

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes, a manual reset can sometimes be needed. the RPC with no txid is not a catch all solution without external utxo management

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It doesnt appear to every break anything as such, but cna sometimes just not work if there is a utxo deep in the chain that hast not been spent.

Author: Strob#3417
Content: I used that walletreset.sh script from stakednotary so it does everything in order maybe that's what I needed!

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes, that sends to self, then waits for a confirm, then does the clean, removes all tx except the one where you consilidated all utxos

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: there are other solutions out there also, that require daemon restarts, but they will actually reduce the wallet.dats phsyical size.

Author: Strob#3417
Content: Pretty neet script! The only part IM not sure what it does is when it uses rawtransactions. I will have to play with those

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: learnign raw tx is a good idea yes. Will help a lot with manageing things like KMD mining rewards.

Author: Strob#3417
Content: Ok I guess to reduce the size of wallet.dat it must send to other address, delete, recreate and send back.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
yes pretty much. I merged a new param to `importprivkey` a few days ago, not sure if its in dev branch though. That takes a block height to rescan from. 
Using that the process becomes very simple... 
Send to self, wait a few confirms note block height it was confirmed at. 
Restart delete, import key with noted height. The only tx your wallet sees is now the one you just sent. üòÉ

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: after that use cleanwallettransactions to keep wallet.dat at small size

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: in theory this will be the best approch.

Author: Strob#3417
Content: Ok cool!

Author: Mylo#8306
Content:
@Strob that's how i do it.
send to paperwallet
stop daemon
rm wallet.dat
start daemon
import key
ssh with key to other box execute a send back to NN
all automated, 3 times per week.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: it's not as efficient as blackjoker's method of digging into the wallet.dat file.

Author: Mylo#8306
Content: because of the 20minute downtime in restarting kmd each time.
